Interview Descriptions:
Through an agency. 2 phone interviews followed by an in-person.  My skills, background and experience made me an ideal candidate. 
The passed on me and said I was culturally not a fit. Translation, I’m pretty sure, you’re too old. I was about 10 years older than those who interviewed me.
Interview Questions: Behavioral or scenarios

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Menlo Park, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Panel interview, group interview with 5-6 questions each. Each question highlighted attributes about teamwork, collaboration and learning. 
The process takes a long time with HR, but be persistent but patient. It takes time for the right person to fill the position.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had a conflict with a coworker

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Overall the interview process itself was fine. Had two phone interviews before I did an all day in person interview with the team. However, after the final interview, I would have appreciated to find out either way whether I got the position (even after following up multiple times, I was never given an answer either way) and it took me nearly two months to get reimbursed for my travel expenses. Because of those two things, it soured my perception of the interview process and organization.
Interview Questions: How have you managed a difficult client or business partner?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Stanford, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: First interview was phone call with hiring manager, then another one with his boss. They definitely over sold themselves and the department, and didn't mention all the political leadership changes happening then.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Human Resources Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met with a number of teams, and they used situational based interviewing (In X situation, what how did you handle it, what was the result, what would you have done differently" They could not schedule interview with all the people they wanted me to meet so I had about 6 to 8  hours of interviews over two days. After sending my thank you notes to all the people I had on my panels (3 of who were affiliates, to whom I sen the thank you notes to in c/o the HR office), I got one of the three back about a week after I sent it marked "Returned to Sender", and the other two arrived with "Return to Sender"  written on the enveloped approximately 5 weeks after the panel interview.  For a company that told me during the interview that collaboration across the enterprise and with affiliates was important, this told me that they do not practice what they say they want. I would not recommend their HR Department.
Interview Questions: It has now been two months since the interview, the holidays have come and gone and the interview has passed. I don't remember what they asked, but nothing was out of the ordinary.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care
Interview Descriptions: There were two phone interviews, one brief one with HR and then an extended one hour phone call with the unit manager. Following this, I interviewed almost two hours in person with the manager, two assistant managers, and a floor nurse. The standard interview questions are tiring and laborious. To prepare, think of specific events that you can use to tell about your RN experiences.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time that you went above and beyond for a patient or family member.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Stanford Healthcare has a great reputation so I applied to a few openings and interviewed with a couple of teams. Coming from a med-tech industry, I was surprised to learn that there is no standardized interview protocol. For example, I wasn't given a job description and the one that I saw online was awfully vague. The interviewers weren't sure about the basic information that I asked about the new position. They didn't bother to introduce their roles at Stanford or keep an eye contact. Lastly, everyone that I met ( coordinator, office managers, managers, directors) are in their mid-50s.  Being a young, foreign female in Silicon Valley,  I felt a little out of place in this old white boys' club.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Volunteer Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard and straight forward interview. The volunteer coordinator may interview you with another interviewee and have a short discord going. Just be honest and conversate, youll have a good time, interviewer was pretty nice.
Interview Questions: Why did you want volunteer/ past experiences.

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: All interviews that I have done at Stanford have started with a phone interview, and then are followed up with an in-person interview. It was a very typical interview in terms of questions, but I was surprised about being interviewed by the whole team rather than just one person. It was intimidating at first, but then I felt it was to my benefit because I got to see what it would feel like to work as part of their team.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Data Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process started with an HR phone interview in May 2017.
After 2 months HR called to set up interview with a manager, followed by 2 more phone interviews and a final onsite interview. 
Total process total 4 months

If you ever get a call for onsite interview don’t pay for travel expenses from your pocket as I am afraid you will NOT be reimbursed. 
Followed up with HR 10 Times but Stanford Human Resources team are very unethical and unprofessional. 2 months and counting to get reimbursed
Interview Questions: Case Study and Analytical questions

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Full day onsite with several leaders and team members. Offer was submitted onsite at the EOD and everyone was well organized, professional and transparent. Questions were balanced . Overall great experience!
Interview Questions: How I manage Projects end to end

title: Clerical Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Livermore, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of two people taking turns asking questions in a small room. One was the supervisor and the other was the manager. The overall interview was an hour long.
Interview Questions: If the phone was ringing, a customer was in front of you, and your coworker is asking you for a favor, how would you handle this situation? How would you prioritize the situation at hand?

title: Assistant Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Santa Barbara, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Brief,  friendly, and not very talkative. My interviewer emailed me and set up an interview within the week. She was not very enthusiastic but was still professional.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with consenting?

title: Assistant Front Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview, was told they would contact and haven't heard back since . Even with a thank you e mail and the position is still posted.  Reached out again with interest ands still nothing.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to leave the department you have been in for 5 years?

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Somewhat distracted manager, the manger seemed to be pressed for time.  We had an hour scheduled and the interviewer was looking at their watch 15 minutes into the interview.  Took a call for 5 minutes and was reading their phone
Interview Questions: very little technical questions were asked

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Filled with red flags from start to finish. Wouldn't talk salary initially and then low-balled me with the offer. Also asked to speak to three of my previous managers - which is against company policy. Only HR can confirm dates worked, salary, etc. And then also asked for past performance reviews. Past performance reviews contain private financial information from companies. They didn't want to accept this and my offer was rescinded. Feel like I dodged a bullet.
Interview Questions: Just basic interview questions on the phone and then grilled in person.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Registered Nurse applying for a very competitive position in a densely populated area in healthcare. The process takes very long time. Response to an online application can take months.
Interview Questions: Why this organization?

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Initial meeting was a group test. Followed by an in person panel interview. The interview took approximately 30 minutes on site with the Program Director and a member of the leadership staff. It was very professionally conducted and thorough. The interview was direct and to the point.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Stanford, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, then in-person interview with multiple managers a few weeks later.  From there it took months for the recruiter to get back to me with an offer and the salary negotiations were like a root canal.  My start date was a full month and a half after signing the offer letter due to their archaic recruiting, onboarding and payroll process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: R&D Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Ithaca, NY) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very relaxed and informal. I had a video call with the supervisor and his grad student where we went over my resume. The supervisor spoke about the various projects they were working on and we discussed which would be the best fit for me.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with us?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Average interview process, both interviews consisted of a panel or at minimum 2 persons. Applied online and received a call the same week and had my phone interview that same Friday. Was invited for an in-person interview the following week and received an offer the same Friday. Overall pleasant experience and accepted offer.
Interview Questions: Behavioral scenarios in order to keep the interview process competitive

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received a call back from unit manager within 2 days of applying. Spoke over the phone for 30 mins. Explained her unit and asked about my experience and current patient population I'm experienced with. Was asked to come for an in person interview. Interview was panel style with manager, assistant manager, clinical nurse specialist. Toured the unit. Lasted about an hour and 30 mins total. Everyone was very pleasant and approachable
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: panel interview they asked questions like Describe a difficult work situation / project and how you overcame it? What are your goals for the future?  Why should we hire you?
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving or have left your job?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview explaining the job and asking about previous experience. Interview took almost an hour. Questions focused on past experience and strength and weakness. Was invited for a panel interview and meet and greet.
Interview Questions: I'm your own words define personal responsibility

title: IT Business Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (San Jose, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Absolutely horrible. First, the recruiter called and left a voicemail with a number that had been disconnected. Really? Secondly, after tracking down the recruiter and passing the phone screen, I was to talk to the hiring manager. He called and told me he had a "migraine" and was going to go home for the day and that he would call me back the very next day. Never heard back. Must have been one long migraine. Absolutely unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience.

title: Clinical Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Two managers (there were supposed to be 3) ended up interviewing me.  They were very laid back, and personable.  They asked a lot of questions just to get to know me.  and only asked 3 behavioral questions.  Interview was not stressful and was very enjoyable.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Psychiatrist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Holistic interview style, met with several other attending and trainees. Questions were about research and clinical interests. Very professional and friendly. Site tours at all training locations with chief residents. Enjoyed lunch with all residents.
Interview Questions: What are you most nervous about in taking this position?

title: A Leadership Role In the Guest Services Department Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA)
Interview Descriptions: During the interview, fairly standard interview questions plus a few situational questions were asked. Look up "most common interview questions" online and prepare accordingly. The interviewers acted professionally; they didn't play the "good cop bad cop" kind of thing. To be honest, it felt like the interview would help them find the kind of people that are good at interviews, but not necessarily the kind of people that would be good at the job.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you? What are your strengths? Why do you want to work for us? Why do you want this position?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Pleasanton, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Good vibe from Office Manager very descriptive in what the position entailed. Was very upfront on salary, benefits and what they were willing to pay. Explained overall work environment and expectations.
Interview Questions: How many years of experience in medical field.

title: Field Services Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Newark, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter contacted me. Discussed role and if it was a good fit. I liked it. They setup a phone interview. Phone interview was 30 mins. Asked about my job experience and technical skills. Phone interview went well. Did an onsite interview, 1 hour long. Got the job.
Interview Questions: Do you have previous project management experience?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was long, multiple rounds, and at times disorganized. The panel interview felt very robotic and the entire team read off of a sheet. I applied 2 months before I received a call back. I had one phone interview and then waiting another 3 weeks. After that I had my first panel interview and then waited another 2 weeks for my final round interview. It was quite tedious.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you received feedback and how you dealt with it.

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewing from out of state, and they were willing to let me do a video conference interview, which was nice. There were general interview/behavioral questions, and some clinical questions. They were very interested in my prior experience and how that could contribute to their position. The questions were very much related to the position and how I would perform the job- very straight forward.
Interview Questions: How I worked with interdisciplinary team members.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Committee based interview with the standard questions.  Looking for nurses with experience.  BSN is a must.  Standard HR screening and background check.  Nothing surprising in the least.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Stanford?

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Received phone call couple days after applying. Have pre-set questions that they ask and write down your answers. Had a panel of 2 managers interviewing me. After interview, received response from managers within 1 week.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a study related to case management that you've read about

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Had a telephone call from management and did an over-the-phone screening. Was invited for a panel interview the following week. Very friendly interviewers and the management team knew exactly what they were looking for in a candidate.
Interview Questions: Q: Tell us about a time when you disagreed with your manager, how did you handle it, and what were the results?

title: Human Resources Transition Logistics and Planning Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the company website and was shortly contacted for a phone screening. Following the phone screen I was invited in for both a 1 on 1 interview and panel interview. Overall the experience was very positive, the staff was extremely friendly and outgoing. Interview questions are genuine and allow you to discuss your experience and character. There was very frequent communication during the hiring process and I always felt connected and in the loop.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you created something.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Pleasanton, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: 6-person panel interview with current members on the team I applied for. Was given a topic 24 hours before the interview and asked to create 2 documents and a presentation.
Interview Questions: Describe a challenging situation you've encountered and how did you respond to it?

title: Clinical Nurse II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for an experienced RN position. The interview was a panel interview of frontline RNs and assistant nurse managers, most of the questions I had were behavioral interview questions of about six to eight on describing experiences I had in the past. Additionally, there were two case scenarios where a situation was given and asked what my next steps would be. The first was a clinical and prioritization of care/managing clinical emergencies scenario and the other was a communication/conflict management case between a coworker.
Interview Questions: What are three qualities that are essential that a nurse needs to have when working with patients? Now, rate yourself on each of those qualities.

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: They do not spend much time on the interview process. They will hire you if you meet basic requirements because they just need warm bodies to fill roles. Stanford mostly uses staffing agencies to fill positions because it is difficult to find skilled, qualified information technology personnel in the Bay area.  They pay a lot of money to the staffing agencies for consultants but then they do not pay their full-time staff anywhere near the same amount they pay the staffing agency. If you meet their basic requirements, they will hire you. Your salary will depend on your ability to negotiate.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with Epic before?

title: PRN Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Sanford, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online process looked a few days. The hiring supervisor communicated through email. The interviewer asked questions to answers they wanted to hear rather than what the interviewee provided and criticized most answers that were given. The questions itself were not difficult but again the interviewer wanted answers they wanted to hear.
Interview Questions: What are your weakness working in the role as a phlebotomist?

title: Clinical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, recieved a call back a few days later for a phone interview. Set up an face to face interview a few days later and had my 2nd interview 2 days after that. Soon as i left i was given an offer.
Interview Questions: Behavioral

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care
Interview Descriptions: First I interviewed with the manager. Then I returned two weeks later to interview with the clinical team. I had three panel interviews, the 1st 30 min interview was with three physicians, the second 30 min interview with 3 NPs and the 3rd 30 min interview with 1 MD and 3 RNs.
Interview Questions: Pretty basic interview questions. Why do I want to work in the specific field? My strengths and weaknesses? What I was looking for in a job?

title: Bio-Medical Equipment Technician (35907) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Rather picky employer. The organization subjects candidates through a 25 - 30 minute customer care questionnaire process right after a job submission online. A consideration is out of the picture if a candidate's answers are not what the hiring department wants to hear. An e-mail will be sent to the candidate within 24-hours of the questionnaire's submission whether his/her application will be considered further. 

One additional note: Look elsewhere if a candidate's qualifications do not satisfy 90% or higher of the job description.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: BMT Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I sent in my application on 12/27, got an email from the lead PA about 3 weeks later. We set up an interview in mid February, and I got an offer beginning of March!
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions, why this specialty, tell me about your experience

title: Director, Supply Chain Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford Health Care
Interview Descriptions:
Interviewed with 5 people, general questions, nothing very difficult. Lunch interview followed by a call with the VP and SVP
Tell us about your background?
Why you want to work at Stanford Healthcare?
Questions on my past work experience?
Interview Questions: N/A

title: New Grad Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care
Interview Descriptions: 4 person panel interview w/ 4 nurse managers, as well as some other managers dialing in (telecast). 2 HR people also in the room. Structured interview, 4 questions per person, 2 min allowed per question, goes in alphabetical order. When you get there they will ask you to rank what units you want to be at. Then they tell you what order you will enter the room and where you will sit. All behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you were on a team that functioned badly. Tell me about a team you were on that functioned well.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had one phone interview and one in person interview with two people total. It took 2 weeks and didn't make it to the third round. The phone interview and in person interview questions were the same so I didn't know if I should answer them differently or say the one I had practiced for that certain question. I had to email the employee that contacted me first and asked her if I made it to the next round to get the second in person interview
Interview Questions: Review your resume and highlight skills and abilities related to this position

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard interview process, with two rounds of interviews. Met with multiple people in management, all in one on one interviews. FYI, they have apparently recently dropped the personality test for management positions.
Interview Questions: "Where do you think we can improve?"

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Aptos, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview with a recruiter.  The recruiter was well spoken and professional.  The recruiter spent the majority of time explaining things.  The questions leaned toward being clever rather than promoting meaningful discussion about accomplishments and experience.
Interview Questions: What tools have you used?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Stanford, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Panel of nurses (for a PA position) and MD director with 10-15 clinical diagnosis and treatment questions (gave scenario with S/S and then asked what I would do, prescribe, order...).  Had child abuse question.   Asked about commitment to quality care, patient care, C-I-CARE (memorize this).  Asked why I left my last position.  Lasted about an hour.
Interview Questions: Gave the signs and symptoms for gout and asked the Dx and Tx.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (San Jose, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a pPhone interview two months later. I was invited to the in-person panel interview. HR and managers were very friendly and took turn asking questions. Be yourself and answer honestly.
Interview Questions: Tell me what your employer would like to see an improvement during your last evaluation?

title: Clinical Nurse Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care
Interview Descriptions: HR called to invite me to an interview.  I had 2 rounds of interviews that lasted 1 hour each with both other Clinical Nurse Specialists and with the management team that I would be working with.  The process was very professional and both rounds of interviews included thoughtful discussion of a variety of topics in addition to specific interview questions.
Interview Questions: They asked a series of standard behavioral interviewing questions.  One question included asking about my experience with specific longer term projects (i.e. quality/outcomes projects), what measures were used, and if there were any economic benefits (i.e. did you save the organization money) as a result of the project.  No case study type questions asked.

title: Visualization Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
After connecting with someone from the Analytics team, we quickly scheduled a phone call. It was a group interview. Nothing outrageous. After the interview I did not hear back from them for almost a week. Then I was asked to appear onsite (Palo Alto Office) for a half day interview session. 4-5 rounds with one break in-between.

Onsite interview involved 8-10 people interviewing during one on one sessions & some panel sessions. It was really informative to meet some of the architects & managers. Most of the questions were scenario based & to evaluate my experience. A few technical questions were asked. 

Interview went pretty good. After a couple of weeks I heard back that they have decided to move ahead with other candidates as they are looking for someone with more technical expertise. 

Most of the employees wear formals / business casuals so please dress up for the interview.
Interview Questions:
1. What questions will you ask for a given business requirement topic?
2. Some whiteboard assignments
3. Discussion over visualization best practices
4. What value would you bring to this organization?
5. Technical question (table design, standards), SDLC based questions (lean, agile methodologies)
6. Behavioral questions (STAR)

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview and manager interview. One on one at first then passed that. Got a phone call to do a panel interview and passed that as well. Then reference check and background check, passed that as well.
Interview Questions: Describe the time when you did a project and what did you do

title: Pre Kidney Transplant Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford Health Care
Interview Descriptions: I had 3 interviews. The first was a phone interview with the manager and a nurse. The second interview was a 9 nurse panel interview where they asked a lot of behavioral questions. The last were interviews with the surgical director and the medical director which was intense but a great experience.
Interview Questions: Why are you looking into transitioning?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Long but worth it. Manager interview, initial. Then panel interview a few days later. Final offer 2 weeks after, background check, paperwork, overall 2 month long process. The questions were scripted, behavioral type questions. Be yourself and don't reveal your party animal ways, be professional and you should be golden.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a recent project, what is your contribution about it

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied 8/11, I got called by the hiring manager to schedule an interview. I interviewed with the unit manager and the assistant manager. They were very friendy and welcoming. They do not make you feel intimidated or scared. The interview lasted approximately 1 hour. They also gave me a tour of the unit. They allowed me to ask questions. What I like the most is that the process was fast and I was able to directly talk to the hiring manager. The same day after my interview as I was walking out of the hospital, the manager called me and said that she couldn't wait another day more and would like to extend me the job offer. I said yes, of course! It's Stanford!
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you were a team player?

title: Business Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Menlo Park, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Had 4 rounds of interviews. Interviewed by recruiter, followed by manager twice - phone and video conferencing. 

Advice: Unless the hiring manager or recruiter/HR department emails you a complete agenda and willing to pay for your trip please do not go. If you are still willing to pay for your self then please ask for agenda for interview, panel information, and decision making time. 

This reflects the culture of the team, management style, and decision making process. If these simple things are not stream lined think about projects.

Worst interview ever I had and disappointing.
Interview Questions: Behavioral.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Stanford, CA)
Interview Descriptions: If you do your clinical at Stanford hospital, people already know you which can be an advantage. Then there is a week of reviewing skills. Then there is about a year of Residency where they ask you how you are doing in the process because they would like to keep you.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Stanford?

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Menlo Park, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Talked to supervisor and clinic manager and met with the physicians after. The interview process was easy. I got a call to interview, and got hired the same day after interviewing.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation and how you handled it

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Menlo Park, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: this was for the residency program. Group/Panel/Video interviews, managers and directors can watch videos. You choose where they are hiring and then matches may happen that way. After original interview from one of the three mentioned, interviews on the units may happen in a unit panel environment.
Interview Questions:
Behavioral Style questions.  
Ex. Tell me a time when you had a difficult patient, how did you handle this.  Working in group settings, how did you handle conflict

title: Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a long process. I had to wait for a phone call. Then they said they had to reschedule. Then they had told me that they had found someone more qualified for the position. It was frustrating because I didn't know whether to call and follow up or wait for their answer. Since I didn't follow up they thought I was disinterested.
Interview Questions: How do you embody CI-CARE?

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very fast, first spoke to a recruiter, then 3 phone interviews then a half day of in person interviews. The process was fast. The people were friendly and questions were fair -- most seemed liked a skills assessment and whether I was cultural fit. The one issue of note: I was required to pay all of my travel expenses for the in-person interview up front and it took over a month to get reimbursed. They also require a W-9 for reimbursement, which was new to me. The manager did call personally to tell me I didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: Why are you looking for a job at this time in your life?

title: PT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: There were behavioral questions and clinical questions. The panel ask questions by turn. They are quite friendly, but I was nervous. You have a chance to tour the facility, but it won't take too long.
Interview Questions: Q: Strengths & Weakness

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, I was invited for a Skype interview with the PI and the rest of the clinical research team. They asked me a variety of questions but appeared to look down when I was speaking, or rather mumble to themselves.  They were very positive in the end, asking, "how soon can you start?" but later waited a week to reply via email to inform me of the non-selection decision.
Interview Questions: They asked why I felt comfortable working with patients, if I had ever dealt with cancer patients, and how soon I can get to Palo Alto.

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was an initial phone interview with the manager. After that, I was called into the clinic to do an in person interview. It was a panel type interview with 7 people. 2 held the some position as me, two were management, and the others were other members of the care team.
Interview Questions: Situational questions that reflected on past experiences.

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was entirely over the phone, with no in-person interview requested.  1st warning.  Talked to the hiring manager as a contractor and he wanted me to start the next day (!)  It was odd; there was no vetting of my skills and entire conversation took place in less than an hour.  I should have seen the red flags - the fact that he didn't want a face-to-face interview should have alerted me.
Interview Questions: Describe your infrastructure Project Management experience. 2nd warning

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: First you have to apply online, then take an assessment test.  If you do not past the assessment test you will not be a desirable candidate for Stanford Health Care.  If you pass the assessment test, you will be called for a panel interview.
Interview Questions: Not applicable

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: was referred in  by an employee. They called me in for an interview one and half month later. interviewed with 2 managers. I taken through the day to day operations. and after 3 hours of being there was offered the job
Interview Questions: why you want to work at stanford healthcare?

title: Development Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough process and lots of behavioral interviewing questions. Stanford is a great organization and it prides itself on a thorough process to bring in new employees. There are lots of tenured people here, and they say "be careful who you hire... because no one ever leaves."
Interview Questions: Typical behavioral interviewing questions

title: Associate Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Test with english, math, CS parts. Then a 1 hour interview on what to expect and talk about experiences. The on-site interview was a panel consisting of the team you would be working with. It was an hour and were great to talk to. Focused more on potential to learn rather than what I already knew.
Interview Questions: Talked about past work experience and what to expect

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Apply for the position 
Submit resume
take the assessment
call with the recruiter
recruiter then forwards resume to hiring manager
hiring manager responds 
schedule the 1:1 with hiring manager
Schedule interview with a panel of people
Send a thank you note to hiring manager
Wait a few weeks for a call
Accept/decline offer
Complete background check
Complete drug test
Obtain start date
Interview Questions: Why should I hire you?

title: Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care
Interview Descriptions: Went through an agency recruiter so first interview was smoo to setup. After interview I heard back the next day on next steps to fly out but  was slow to setup but it was over the holidays.
Interview Questions: No real difficult questions but I have interviewed and been interviewed many times so no real surprises, they are very concerned about cultural fit which I appreciated.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care
Interview Descriptions: New Grads must go through a rigorous and competitive hiring process. It starts with a phone interview, then there are group interviews, and then you interview in different departments in front of a panel. Be as polished as possible. Many good candidates don't make it. So, don't feel bad if that's you. Good luck.
Interview Questions: Stanford uses a personality assessment tool via a third party product. They swear by it, but i'm not convinced.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: HR can take a very long time. Resumes are screened through HR and given to manager who shares with unit educator, CNS, and assistant managers. After interview (generally phone) with assistant manager, there is a panel interview with floor nurses and charge nurses, as well as unit educator/management
Interview Questions: Most difficult family/patient situation I had encountered and how I dealt with it

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Stanford, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening with recruiter, then phone interview with hiring manager, then 1:1 interviews with a few people. Received an email less than a week later w/offer. Interviews were not extremely difficult. I would say they were average.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone, 1:1, then panel. Sometimes it was with the director and or doctor or medical director. I like panel interviews because the whole team is involved with hiring a potential person to join the team.
Interview Questions: Standard behavioral and scenario questions.

title: New Grad Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: In a word intense! Be prepared to think on your feet. The process is timed, meaning you will have a maximum of 2 minutes to answer each of the 4 questions posed to you. There will be 3 other candidates in the room with you and up to 10-12 managers and HR people scoring your answers. Keep in mind it's behavioral, they want to hear a clinical situation describing what you actually did, not what your nurse did or what you would do in a hypothetical situation. You will be asked a question covering 4 areas of nursing from care/comfort to critical thinking.
Interview Questions: To begin with you will be asked to interview the candidate next to you and in 2 minutes explain why he/she would be a good fit for Stanford.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Stanford, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Three phone interviews before I was invited for an onsite interiew. The interview started at  9:00 a.m and ended at 2:00 p.m. I was introduced to all my colleagues, and the interview went quite well. Most of the questions were regarding - financial modeling, variance analysis, costing...
Interview Questions: Tell me something about your skill sets

title: Senior Clinical Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I got my job via a strong internal employee referral. At first for a 2-3 weeks nobody called. Then a guy from HR called and did a basic screen. Then after a week talent acquisition send an email to schedule a phone interview. Phone interview was very basic hr screening. Then a phone interview with hiring manager was scheduled after 3 weeks. that went well and was invited for face 2 face the following week. After a week offer was presented. Offer was more than what I had asked for so couldn't complain.
Interview Questions: None , all very basic. In fact no technical questions

title: Dietetic Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Stanford, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: You will get a call to schedule an interview. You go to the department you are being interviewed for and you will be seated. You will be called when the hiring manager is ready, may be right away or up to 30 minutes. During the interview, you will be asked about your work experience.
Interview Questions: What was work experience do you have?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and automatically got a reply saying they weren't interested so I started interview at other hospitals. A few weeks later I got a call for an interview. They told me their automated system sends that email to everyone that applies. I had a 30 min phone interview.
Interview Questions: I was asked about what specific machines I was familiar with from previous hospitals.

title: Contracts Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview followed by a two hour in person interview meeting with various business stakeholders. The interviewing panel asked various questions including personality based questions as the organization is very much personality driven.
Interview Questions: Everything from past experience through to personality typle.

title: Help Desk Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care in May 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Was contacted by Insight Global who initially asked about my work experience.  After talking with an account manager and sending my resume and a couple of references, they set me up with a phone interview for a Stanford Clinic opening soon.  

I joined in on a phone conference interview with the hiring manager and 2 other employees.  I was prepared for a phone interview and had been preparing for the past 2 weeks.  I didn't expect the first phone interview to be technical rather than behavioral.  However, I did enjoy it and they were simple questions.  The interviewer stated situations and took me through the process of solving them.  I can honestly say it was fun for me!
Interview Questions: What files would you back up on someone's computer?

title: Migration Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: interview process was easy and no problems
Interview Questions: no hard questions and interview was easy.

title: Insurance Verification Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Redwood City, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with 4 managers but didn't here anything for 3 months. Each one asked questions it was a fairy easy interview the managers only hire you based on if they like you or not, not on your experience
Interview Questions: Have you ever managed a team before

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stanford Health Care
Interview Descriptions: I met the boss in a conference. We talked a lot about the project and i asked whether there's is a chance that I can be a postdoc for you. That it.
Interview Questions: I didn't really enter the employer's lab before I applied for this job. There is a gap between my expectation and reality, facility-wise.

title: Pre Analytical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The process was long the director was not very friendly she started to ask me question and did not introduce herself, when I asked her her name she point to her badge which was backwards. She seemed very angry.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Medical Director, Surgical Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Forwarded my CV to recruiters who contacted me for two separate one hour phone interviews.  First interview was with two recruiters, second interview was with one individual.  The interviewers were cordial and friendly.  The phone interviews were intended to narrow the group of candidates down to those who would be offered visits to Stanford for in person interviews.
Interview Questions: How would you design a new hospital?

title: Materials Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews were one hour each.
Interview Questions: Don't recall an unexpected question

title: Histology Services Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: My resume was presented to Stanford by a recruiter for Stanford.  I was contacted to see if I had an interest in applyng.  I researched the organization and then I submitted my application along with my resume for their review.
Interview Questions: What made me want to apply at Stanford?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with supervisors. Fairly simple process. Applied online, call from HR, followed by interview in person. Took 3 months for an offer from the first interview to hire. Longer process than normal, but  Stanford only hires the best!
Interview Questions: I don't remember any questions.

title: Courier Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Stanford, CA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was very informal. Just showed up when requested, had a nice chat with the head of the department, was given a small tour of the operations. That was it. After clearing a background check I was in.
Interview Questions: They focused a lot on how well I handled stress.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was a great experience, they were very kind and straight forward. I would say that be prepared with what you can offer as an possible candidate. Also, I would not try to overly impress them. Just because Stanford is a world known hospital does not mean that they are looking for big impressions, rather they are looking for someone humble, down to earth and can get the job done. I say be you, be honest, and you will do just fine.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position? What can you bring to the department?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (San Jose, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Hired through a registry, toke in all my shot records, had background check signed necessary paper work. Had a 1:1 interview, a fit test for 95 resperator. The interview was pleasant. I don-know what what else to say about the interview. You keep asking me the same questions.
Interview Questions: How long I had worked a Cna The interview was great

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Stanford, CA) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: I already had 2 years of intensive hands on experience in the specific medical field I applied for and was referred by my former employer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I attended 1 interview with a panel firing questions at me.  The job was presented as an exempt position.  When the written offer came through it was presented as non-exempt which offers less in benefits and accrued vacation pay.
Interview Questions: Questions were very standard.  What were your contributions in your previous line of employment.  How did you impact cost savings.  What are your strengths/weaknesses.  What was the most difficult part of your job.  How did you overcome the difficulties.

title: Organization Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with Recruiter and another manager. Behavioral Interviewing Panel. Hiring decision thereafter. Today, an online or phone assessment of attributes is also required. Brush up on your behavioral interview responses - i.e., how you've actually handled situations in similar positions in the past.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in Healthcare

title: Clinical Trials Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Stanford, CA) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: Was introduced to hiring manager through an employee referral (through email). Send my resume and cover letter, and manager suggested I get to the site for an interview. The interview process was very informal (probably does not apply to other job titles, but in my case it was as if I already had the job). It was more of a conversation about what the team is working on and what I will be doing. Didn't ask me any questions about me, only asked if I have any questions for them. Salary was not negotiable.
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions for us?

title: Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Stanford Health Care (Palo Alto, CA) in Apr 2008
Interview Descriptions: To get to the panel interview, it took at least a couple of months.
Interview Questions: Attitudes and experience
